main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Lakota, North Dakota on December 19, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as triangular in shape with faint red-orange lights,The object moved erratically and changed speed during observation,The object was lost from radar when it passed overhead, The sighting lasted between 5 and 10 minutes, Witnesses included a contact representative and a soil scientist, both aged 55.
sighted object: triangular-shaped object with faint red-orange lights
witness description: a contact representative from the Veterans Administration and a soil scientist from the US Soil Conservation Service, both from Grand Forks, ND
